headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: GA Prosecutor Nathan Wade Questioned About Relationship With Fani Willis. Aired 11:30a-12p ET

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: ASHLEIGH MERCHANT, DEFENSE ATTORNEY FOR MIKE ROMAN
utterances.sentences: And just so everybody's clear. All I asked you is your affidavit. You submitted proof of one flight that she paid for it. That's all I'm asking. Correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: With the explanation, yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. All I need it. You said in the affidavit that you roughly shared travel, though, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, this roughly sharing travel, you're saying she reimbursed you?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: She did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And where did you deposit the money she reimbursed you?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That was cash. She didn't -- she didn't give me any checks.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, she paid you cash for her share of all these vacations?

utterances.speaker: SCOTT MCAFEE, FULTON COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT JUDGE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Shafer, (PH) you'll step out if you do that again.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And so, all of the vacations that she took, she paid you cash for?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am. MERCHANT

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And you included those in deductions on your taxes, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: No, you did not?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. We'll get to that in just a minute, then. Let's see. So, the only thing that you have actual documentary proof, not cash, is this one receipt that you attach to the affidavit, is that correct?

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I object to that question. That is a mischaracterization of the assertion that is in the affidavit.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I'm asking --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: So, then he can deny it. I think he can fend for himself. Miss Merchant.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Is this the only written proof that you have of a trip she paid for?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That I have?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, you submitted the one piece of written evidence that you have that she paid for something? Everything else is in cash, is that accurate?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: That's not accurate? OK. Please tell me what other receipts do you have then that show that she paid for things?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I don't have them.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, this is the only receipt that you have to show that she paid for travel?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I have. Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Thank you. In your divorce case, you filed a domestic relations financial affidavit, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. The first one you filed was in January 2022, right?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: They're about. Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And those are under oath?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And you also filed corporate taxes in 2022, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And tell me about your business. Are you -- do you have a partnership or are you a solo practitioner?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: As it stands today?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So, today, I have a separate P.C. My law partner has his own separate P.C.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So -- but we're under the same umbrella -- under the same roof. So, we share expenses, we share income, and we split it.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, are you a partnership?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: We are a partnership in the sense of we share expenses, we share income --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Are you registered with the state of Georgia as a partnership?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So, the WBC Firm that included myself, Terrence Bradley, and Christopher Campbell, we were registered with the Secretary of State as a partnership --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: For a short period of time. When --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: That was dissolved, is that right in 2023?

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to object. The witness answers his question.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Wade, do you have something else to add there?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did. When things happen, and we excused Mr. Bradley from that partnership, it left Christopher Campbell and myself. So, now you have two separate P.C.s under the same umbrella sharing expenses and income.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, let me just narrow down my questions then. Are you registered? And have you been registered at any time in the state of Georgia as Wade and Campbell? WADE

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You've never been registered as a partnership.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: As Wade and Campbell, no, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Wade and Campbell. Yes. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: But as Wade-Bradley-Campbell, yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Wade-Bradley-Campbell was registered on April 1, 2021, and administratively dissolved on September 8, 2023, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Other than that partnership, you have always been registered as law office of Nathan Wade?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Not with Chris Campbell.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Objection. The taxes -- the relevance of them at this point -- the relevance of this entire business structure doesn't seem clear to me as other impeaching or relevant to the issues that the courts -- under the court's consideration. But insofar as we're talking about tax returns and other things like that, certainly that's -- should be redacted. And I would object to the relevance of it.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I agree they should be redacted. I don't agree to the relevance. But I haven't tried to attend to them yet, Judge. I'm just marking them right now so that everyone can follow.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. And what is the eventual relevance that you were getting at here?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm going to ask him because one of the things that we have to show in this case is a personal and financial interest. So -- and he's talked about how he was reimbursed for these things. And so, I have a -- I have a right to go into the veracity of those things.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, let's see. Seven, eight -- sorry, nine, and then 10. All right. So, right now, I'm just going to show you what I've marked as these exhibits.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Ms. Merchant. Can I see what you're showing --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. of course. All from the USB drive or KVM.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Can I approach, Judge?

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: You may.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I'm going to show you what I marked as seven, eight, nine, and 10 to see how these relevant as I ask you some questions.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, these are sworn -- the -- I'm first going to ask you about the domestic relations financial affidavit. These are sworn. They're filed under oath, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And the most recent one that you filed was filed on January 26, 2024?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, a few weeks ago?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And in that one, you said that you made $9,500 each month, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You said that in 2022 -- well, in 2022, in this case alone, isn't it true you're paid $303,000 -- over $303,000?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I was paid?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes. In this case. Fulton County -- by Fulton County.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I see where you going. So --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And, Judge, I just want him to answer the question. If he wants to explain it, I have no problem with that.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Mr. Wade, just listen to the question asked and just ask -- answer the question asked. MERCHANT

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, ma'am. That is not true.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You are not paid over $300,000 by Fulton County?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, ma'am. I was not.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. How much were you paid in 2022 then?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So, what I was beginning to explain was Fulton County wrote a check to my firm.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: What happens at that point is the checks are then deposited, as you have the bank statements. You see that. And then they are dispersed between the three of us.So, there was Mr. Bradley, there was Mr. Wade, and there was Christopher Campbell, a third, a third, a third. So, when you asked me if I was paid $300,000, the answer was no. I got a third of that, that went to my personal firm. Now, once the money was distributed to my personal firm, obviously the expenses come out of that. And I get, at the end of the day, whatever the profit is. So, I did not get $300,000. No, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Again, a third of that came to the law firm of Nathan Wade.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, you're saying that the law firm of Nathan Wade did not receive checks from Fulton County government over $300,000 in the year of 2022?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That's a different question. A third of the 300,000 came to Nathan Wade.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Again, I'm not asking what went in your pocket? I'm asking where -- was the law firm of Nathan Wade paid over $300,000 in 2022?

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: I know. I -- but I think we're dancing around the point there. So, I'm on time, Ms. Merchant.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: That's fine. I can move on, Judge. Thank you. So, you said that they were dispersed amongst all of you -- or put into an account with all of you. So, it's your testimony that for 2022, every check you received from Fulton County government went into an operating account with you, Bradley, and Campbell.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, no. That's not what I testified to. So, the way Bradley and Campbell firm has established an account when we decided to purchase a building in 2022. At that point, every piece of income that came in to the entity went into that account.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: And then after expenses were paid, it was split a third, a third, a third. Right? Once that was dissolved, then the funds would go into a different account, my Account -- one of my accounts. And then I would disperse the funds between now Attorney Campbell and myself, one half and one half.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Make sense?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: It does. Let me maybe more direct then. So, the Synovus operating account that you had for Wade, Bradley, and Campbell.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The checks from Fulton County from January of 2022 until June 17, 2022, those checks were deposited in that operating account.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Starting on July 15, 2022, the checks you received from Fulton County up until May 26, 2022, all went into an escrow account that you had at Fifth Third Bank, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, not all of them. Some of them --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Not all of them?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Some of them. Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, it's your testimony that some of your checks from July 15, 2022, up until May 26, 2023, some of them went into an account outside of Fifth Third Bank.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: No, no. I object to the relevance of the financial transactions.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: How much money you made is highly relevant in this case, it's the personal financial business, and where the money was. And -- I mean, it's just a follow up on other things that he's testified to.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: And why is how much money he made irrelevant?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Because he represented in a -- in a -- it's very relevant. He filed an affidavit with the court saying with another court -- he told another judge that he made $9,500 a month. That's what he swore to. And --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. So, this entire inquiry is just to try and establish that prior inconsistent statement?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. I'll give you a minute or two more to try that. But we're going to have to move on.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK, great. Thank you. So, I know you're saying that you only got a third of the $300,000. But you were paid over --- the firm was paid over $300,000 in 2022, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: But -- all right. Ms. Merchant, it's not what I'm saying. It -- the numbers that are there, it's the -- it's the truth. The funds were paid. They were divvied between the three of us going into an operating account. Expenses paid out of it.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: At the end of that, the 9000 figures which you have.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, that's where you got the 9000-figure from?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And let's see. Let's -- prior to when you filed for divorce, in November 2021, you would use Mr. Bradley's credit card to pay for things with Ms. Willis, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I've never --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And then pay him back in cash?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I've never used Mr. Bradley's credit card in my --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You've never used his credit card?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Never.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: For transactions to anything with Ms. Willis, as out to dinner or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I've never --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Hotels?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I've never used Mr. Bradley's credit card. I've never used anyone else's credit card. Not even my father's. And we have the same name.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Ma'am, I've never used someone else's credit card.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Can you take a look at the bank records that I gave you? That's the largest tab you have.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: For the record, which exhibit is this?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: It is exhibit -- hold on, Judge. Exhibit Nine. It should be the largest section you thought.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) before they start --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: We find things from that -- these exhibits hadn't been tendered, and I maintain my relevance objections.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right. Let's see what the next question is. And maybe then that objection is going to be highly relevant.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Is that an accurate copy of your Capital One statements that you provided in discovery to -- is that an accurate reflection of your Capital One records?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That I provided in discovery to whom?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: To your divorce lawyers. Or some -- or that you provided in the divorce proceedings?

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Is the -- is the question, does he recognize if I say?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I'm asking if it's a statement. Thanks.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: I think that is the question.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, this is a thick document, but I believe you if you say that this is -- this is what my wife divorce lawyer gave you. I believe it.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Your name is on every page of that document, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: On every page?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Pretty much every page, if not every page.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, it's not on every page. No, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: They're all Capital One Bank records?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: They are.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Please, take your time. Look through it. Tell me if there's anything that you think is not yours.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. They're appear to be.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And those bank records show that you paid for travel with Miss Willis.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to -- I'm going to object the relevance of these documents in the --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: I think -- are you attending Exhibit Nine?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I'm going to, Judge. And they're highly relevant to the -- there -- the whole --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Well, just asked him a question about the contents of them. They haven't been admitted yet. So, why don't we start there?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Thanks. Those show travel that you and Miss Willis took.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Well, I --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Well -- so, you're asking about the contents of something that hasn't been admitted yet? Right?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I'm asking him if that's what it shows because I know that they're going to object on relevance.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Well, first, we got to see if it's -- you've authenticated it, perhaps. And before we get into other details of what's in it, I think that should be admitted.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I can tender them that's fine. I move to admit them.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Objection. On relevance.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: On relevance. All right. And on that, overruled. Ms. Merchant.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Those records demonstrate that you paid for travel with yourself and Ms. Willis, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: They should.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And let's just talk about that travel.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The first trip is Belize in March 2023. Is that a trip that you took with Miss Willis?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Or you asked -- MERCHANT

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: To Belize. I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Did you take a trip to California with Ms. Willis in 2023?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Did you pay for those trips on that credit card?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I use the credit card to book the travel. But understand --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: She paid you back in cash?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Well, let me say this. Let's take the Belize trip for example, since you started there.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That was a birthday gift to me. So, I paid nothing for that trip. Zero.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, the charges that are on your card, she gave you cash for?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: She did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, all of the charges --

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. You're going to let the witness to finished answering the question.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Oh, did you have more?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I wanted to get into the charges on the car because -- so, traveling with her is a -- is a task. You can probably imagine the tension that happens. So, for safety reasons, she would limit her transactions.I mean, imagine trying to walk through an airport or sit at a restaurant or do anything. So, there was no -- there's no attempt to conceal -- it's a credit card. Everything is here. So --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And -- that's not what I asked.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: What I asked was the charges for Belize in March 2023 on that credit card, those are things you purchased to go with Miss Willis -- with Miss Willis to Belize.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Those are -- those are things that we booked with my card that she paid.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, those show up on your credit card?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: They do.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And you're saying that she paid you cash to reimburse you for all of that?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: She did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And she paid you cash for both of your portions or just hers?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Both.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: The entire trip.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, the food, tattoo parlor, all that stuff, she paid for?

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to -- (INAUDIBLE) the question.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: There was no -- there was no tattoo parlor in Belize.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The charges -- there's a -- there's a tattoo parlor on the charges. I'm not getting into what it was for. I'm just asking if everything that's on that card related to Belize, she paid you back for?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: She paid for. Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Let's talk about California. In May 2023, you all went to California together.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And you booked plane tickets?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And her name was on those plane tickets.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: They were.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And so, I know you said that you were worried about security and things like that, but that wasn't her name. When she traveled, she had the username. WADE

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And you paid for those plane tickets, and you paid for a hotel?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So, again, the card? Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You used your credit card? And I'm not asking about after what happened. I'm asking did you use your credit card to book your flight and hotel to California?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And there have a lot of Ubers on there as well, for California. Did you pay for those Ubers as well?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Didn't --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: We were in Napa.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And you're saying that Miss Willis -- are you saying that this was paid you back for that?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Did she pay for the entire trip, or did she pay for her half of the trip?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: The Napa trip? She paid for the excursions. So, the expenses sort of balanced out. I mean there was never -- let me be clear. There was never a time when I would say, hey, I bought dinner. Dinner costs $25. You need to give me $25.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: If you've ever spent any time with Miss Willis, you understand that she's a very independent proud woman.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I object. We're not --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So, she's going to the --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Overruled. Mr. Wade.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So, she's going to insist that she carries her own weight. And it actually was a point of contention between the two of us. She is going to pay her own way.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So -- I mean, we ask the question to make sure that you answer it. In California trip that you paid for, you're saying that she did not pay you back for cash instead, she paid for excursions, and you believe that was roughly half?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No. She gave me some cash, yes. MERCHANT

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: But what I'm saying is that the -- everything that we did when we got into Napa, she paid for them.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The trip that she booked on her credit card in Miami, did you pay her cash back for your half of that?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, you never pay her back for --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: The tickets she bought for you?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No, no. I would say I did pay her back because there were times when I would pay for dinner.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: She would pay for dinner. It would balance out. But in a relationship, ma'am, you don't -- particularly men, we don't go asking back for anything. So, you're not keeping a ledger of things that you pay for versus the thing that she's paying for which is why I said that it was a point of contention because she was very emphatic and adamant about this independent, strong woman thing. So, she mandate that she paid her own way.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: But she's the district attorney of Fulton County, and she has to file financial disclosures disclosing any gifts with anybody that she does business with, in Fulton County, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Let's talk about Tennessee. Booked a cabin in August 2023 and paid for a cabin in Tennessee. That's when you paid for it. I don't know when the trip was. Can you tell us about that?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: August of 2023?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You booked a trip for $1,481.54.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Are you -- are you asking me did I take that trip with Miss Willis or are you asking me --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: First, I was just asking you to acknowledge that that is correct from the records that you paid for a cabin in Tennessee? Do you recall -- and hopefully you can do it from your memory. Do you recall paying for a cabin six months ago, $1,400.81 in Tennessee?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Where are we now? What pages?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: I'm just asking from your memory. Do you remember paying for a cabin in August?

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Not if the -- somebody asked about a particular transaction --

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: I think he can answer whether he remembers or not.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I don't remember --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Mr. Wade, I'm not asking you to go through thousand pages of records. I'm asking if you remember paying for a cabin six months ago in Tennessee.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Do you remember booking a cabin?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Did you go to a cabin with Miss Willis ever?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Ever?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Ever.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You never gone to cabin with Ms. Willis?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Do you ever gone to Tennessee with Miss Willis?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. When was that?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That was around 2022 -- early 2022.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Early 2022? OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: It was a -- it was a day trip. We would --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, you didn't spend a night?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So, it was a day trip.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: We would drive there. Have lunch. Drop back. The reason we would do that is because the attention -- she couldn't get any peace of mind going locally. So, we'd get in my car and drive to someplace off the path and have lunch and drive back.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Is that when you went to Fainting Goat with her, hence in Jasper, Georgia?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No. That's in Georgia. I don't -- I don't -- I don't recall going to Fainting Goat with her.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, the Tennessee day trip -- day trips were not -- were only Tennessee?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Did you ever do these day trips in Georgia?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Do we drive anywhere in Georgia?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Yes. You were --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You were talking about day trips going out --

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, we drove --

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And I'm talking about outside of the metro area. The day trips that you were just talking about -- these trips you were talking about. The ones that you were -- I'm only asking about the ones you were just talking about. Are all of those in Tennessee?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: No. We drove to Alabama before.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. You drove Alabama? Did you go anywhere in Georgia -- North Georgia?

utterances.speaker: CROSS
utterances.sentences: Now, I'm going to object. If it was to direct attention in some way to a timeframe or location, then I think it might be easier for the witness to accurately answer.

utterances.speaker: MCAFEE
utterances.sentences: Ms. Merchant, I think if you don't have the specific details yourself, we need to start getting into specifics were more of maybe broadly phrased questions. we could just be exploring around indefinitely.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Is it -- is it fair to say that you've taken so many trips with her you don't even really remember all the places you've gone?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: So many trips?

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: You're having trouble remembering going -- if you went to North Georgia or not.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Well, you're asking me about specific places, and I want to be candid in my responses. So, I have to jog my memory because these are places that I have frequent, but not with her. So, I want to make certain that if there was ever a time that she accompanied me, that it was candid in the responses.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. Aruba, October of 2022. And in fact, business records are going to get pretty stretched might be a little faster. But did you -- did you take a trip with her to Aruba in 2022?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am. So, that Aruba trip was -- sorry. It was a package deal there. We -- my mother had recently retired, and I decided to take my mother on a cruise.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: And the second leg after the cruise, concluded, D.A. Willis and I went to Aruba. So, that was our one trip, if you will.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. So, my question was, did you go with D.A. Willis to Aruba in 2022?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: Thank you. And you paid for that trip using your business credit card, correct?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And you paid for a cruise as well, correct.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: That's the cruise I was referencing with D.A. Willis, my mother, and myself.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: OK. And that -- let's -- because there's two cruises, so let's just talk about the first one.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: So, the first one was, you took -- (INAUDIBLE) with your mother.

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And so, you introduced D.A. Willis to your mother. That trip, you all took a cruise together. The three of you?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: After the cruise was done, you and D.A. Willis flew to Aruba together and your mom flew home?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And you paid for all of this with your credit card -- on your business credit card?

utterances.speaker: WADE
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MERCHANT
utterances.sentences: And are you saying that Miss Willis paid you cash back for that?
